metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12886 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
stack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12886` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
g++-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
g++-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-base - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-hppa64-linux-gnu - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-locales - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-offload-nvptx - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-source - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gcc-9-test-results - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gccbrig-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gccgo-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gccgo-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gdc-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gdc-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gfortran-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gfortran-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gm2-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gnat-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gobjc++-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gobjc++-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gobjc-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
gobjc-9-multilib - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib32asan5 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib32go14 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib32gphobos76 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib64asan5 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib64go14 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
lib64gphobos76 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libasan5 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgm2-0 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgnat-9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgnatvsn9 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgo14 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libgphobos76 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libstdc++-9-pic - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libx32asan5 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libx32go14 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
libx32gphobos76 - 9.3.0-10ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Upstream has fixed this in GCC9 only as of 2019-05-30. 32-bit ARM only, risky backport, and would require archive rebuild. Setting priority as low for now, we may decide this issue is not worth fixing in stable releases. sbeattie> 14.04 LTS (trusty) Pro Infra and 16.04 LTS (xenial) Pro Infra do not support 32-bit Arm as an architecture.

criterions.comment: gcc-9 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.3.0-10ubuntu2').
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-snapshot package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
